page.title: 07ASHDOWN FOREST FIRE HAZARDS
page.content: Spring and summer bring danger of fire to the Forest with loss of trees, vegetation and wild-life. Fires are often caused by the carelessness of visitors who come to enjoy the amenities which they also destroy - not with intent but by a moment's thoughtlessness. A cigarette end will smoulder in the undergrowth and flare into an inferno with terrifying speed. Burning bracken for agricultural purposes can lead to disaster if not carefully supervised. To combat these fires the old remedy is still the most effective, beaters placed strategically throughout the Forest. Land Rovers with hoses are used and a 22,000 litre water tanker is held in reserve. Fire stations on a wide radius are on permanent standby. As a desperate measure Army helicopters can be brought to the area.
